body_html: Yes, driver is backward-compatible, so 387 would support executables built with both cuda 8 and cuda 9. Not everyone is quick to update driver, though, so pytorch provides builds with cuda 8.
body_text: Yes, driver is backward-compatible, so 387 would support executables built with both cuda 8 and cuda 9. Not everyone is quick to update driver, though, so pytorch provides builds with cuda 8.
body: Yes, driver is backward-compatible, so 387 would support executables built with both cuda 8 and cuda 9. Not everyone is quick to update driver, though, so pytorch provides builds with cuda 8.
